title: Tryndamere is cancer, please nerf him.
body:
He has no counterplay at all, he can 1v1 anyone with ease + take 3 towers at the same time.
He outdamages almost everyone.
He has 5s immunity towards everything
He hits like a train
100% crit rate at a low level.
AoE MS + AD shred
4s dash which also hits like a train
Passive which makes his ult to OP.

True damage should kill him during his ult, thx.

replies.body: Just sayin Im Bronze five and I wreck almost every trynd top lane with voli so hes not that op   {{champion:106}}
because nobody knows how to use anyone in Bronze V.
Unless you're thick then Tryn shouldn't be a problem until like 40 mins where he starts being able to split push towers and kill anyone that tries to stop him.
He isn't that hard to counter he just needs to be cc. Like slows that counters him hard. Buy thornmail if you want to 1v1 him.

play someone like garen, cho'gath or rek'sai who can kite him to hell and kill him soon as his ults down
also hard cc his ult doesn't last very long

Tryndamere himself as a whole is somewhat manageable. Building armor items and etc. as mentioned above can slow his process of murdering everyone on the enemy team under their tower and then getting away on 1 HP because of his ultimate. The thing that really makes me want to insert screwdrivers into my eye sockets and have knives thrown at my groin, is his capability to use his ultimate during CC. He can use it while silenced, stunned, suppressed, anything really. This is one of the few posts, Sackboy, that I agree with you on, to some extent at least. 

His capability to critically strike at level 1 is also pretty %%%%ed as well. There was a mastery ages ago that gave a certain amount of critical strike chance, and it was removed due to summoners winning lane because of a single lucky crit. If that was the case then why is Tryndamere allowed a decent amount of crit chance at level 1, which can be combined with runes if you're that big of an asshole. 

I know this sounds whiny, but I intend it not to be. My opinion of Tryndamere is solely based from gameplay with and against him. He doesn't need to be deleted but something needs to be done.

How about maximum crit chance on his passive scaling with level?

I cant really suggest anything that can remedy him in his current state, as I have no experience with game balancing. His capability to crit early is borderline OP. I don't think there is a champion in this game that can successfully duel a Tryndamere (I acknowledge that there might be a few yes, but not many). 
- You can't lifesteal from him when he uses his ult, as your attacks have no life to steal from him since they are dealing no damage. 
- His slow makes fleeing from him ridiculously hard, on the verge of impossible, which is also followed up by a damaging gap closer. 
Not to mention his slow reduces anyone that is near him, their AD by a flat amount, boosting his advantage on any target really. 

Even if you are beating a Tryndamere in a fight, he gains AD based on missing health, so you are only digging your grave essentially, until he presses that R and goes super saiyan unkillable. Late game gets out of hand, when he can virtually one shot squishy carries like they are nothing. The only thing that balances this champion at the moment in my opinion, is the fountains ability to bypass his ult, because that is the only safe place on the map from a Tryndamere.

played as a tryn v sion the other day.
Got destroyed. it's all about the counterpicks - if your team is stupid and picks a bunch of non-useful champs v tryn, then yeah you're going to get annihilated .
The best way to deal with a tryn is to build tanky straight away, rush a thornmail and then just zone him from farming. Once your top laner gets that exp/cs advantage that tryn is going to struggle.

Whenever I play as Tryndamere I seem to feed because he isn't all that good. An ahead Tryndamere is spooky though.
You say the damage should be able to kill him. Let's do the same for Kayle ult. Now, any toplaner against either of them wins just by having red buff. If Tryndamere is on the blue side of the map he loses. Great idea.

then trynd is yelled to help team fight, and Leona cc's him while trist fires away... he goes for tristana but she w's away, moments later he drops dead ;)

ok trynd is op!

> Tryndamere receives 0.35% bonus critical strike chance per point of FURY he currently has, for a maximum of 35% critical chance at 100 FURY.

> Passive: Tryndamere permanently gains increased attack damage equal to a base amount plus a further bonus per 1% of health he is missing.
>  Attack Damage Bonus: 5 / 10 / 15 / 20 / 25 + 0.15 / 0.2 / 0.25 / 0.3 / 0.35 per 1% of missing health 
> Maximum Bonus: 20 / 30 / 40 / 50 / 60

His damage isn't that high in early levels, but he does have a pretty annoying lvl 3 all outs and an awful lvl 6 experience to the opponents because for the most part, right at lvl 6 nobody can fight back against him.

But as far as team play is concerned, unless he is so incredibly ahead (which is your own fault), his ulti shouldn't be that hard to deal with. I personally think his ulti time span should be something like 3/4/5 sec for lvl 6/11/18 or something along the lines tbh. But who knows, I ain't all that good to judge.
